attributes.action: Keep troops in Afghanistan and increase international cooperation for peace.
attributes.additional_details: It is not in the interests of peace and security to withdraw UK troops from Afghanistan. It will cost more in the long run and is costing lives now. We must change strategy and work diplomatically to find a solution. Any threat towards democracy, and particularly women and children in Afghanistan, threatens the world. Leaving Saigon in 1975 was regarded as strategic error, thus Kabul 202. We must take the long view, be open to a range of propositions and become informed sufficiently to act.
attributes.background:
Urgently keep troops on the ground to mitigate further violence.
Work with other nations to support Afghanis to fight the Taliban.
Welcome Afghani asylum seekers.
Continued aid and support Afghani human rights and education.
Investigate UK connections to Taliban finance and divest UK funds.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Help the people of Afghanistan: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/594723

Redeploy UK Forces to Afghanistan to protect the citizens against the Taliban: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/594823
